title: Job Openings at St. Dominic Catholic Hospital
content:
St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is a 64 bed hospital located in Ogungbade off New Ife road Ibadan. St Dominic Catholic Hospital is the vision of Dominican Sisters of St Catherine of Siena (Italy). We offer various medical services such as: General medicine, internal medicine, O & G, Laboratory, Radiology, to mention just a few. The hospital is run in collaboration with foreign partners. We are registered and licensed by the Corporate Affairs Commission and the Ministry of Health. Also, we are accredited by the NHIS as both primary and secondary health care providers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Registered Nurse and Midwife (Ibadan Resident only)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate care for women during pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.
	Conduct prenatal and postnatal examinations.
	Provide education and support to women and their families on pregnancy, childbirth, and parenting.
	Take/Assist with deliveries and perform midwifery procedures as needed.
	Collaborate with obstetricians and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement care plans.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of patient care.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to improve patient outcomes and satisfaction.
	Stay current with evidence-based practice and professional development.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Midwifery or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Registered Nurse Midwife.
	Current registration as a Registered Nurse / Midwife with the relevant professional body.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice.
	Resident in Ibadan (Iwo Road, New Ife Road axis).


Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Nurse Assistant / Auxiliary Nurse

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Nurse Assistant plays a vital role in supporting the nursing team to provide high-quality patient care.
	Under the supervision of a Registered Nurse, the Nurse Assistant will assist with basic nursing care, perform routine tasks, and ensure the comfort and well-being of patients.


Key Responsibilities


	Patient Care: Assist with basic care needs, such as bathing, dressing, grooming, and toileting.
	Vital Signs: Take and record vital signs, such as temperature, pulse, and blood pressure.
	Mobility Assistance: Help patients with mobility, transfers, and positioning.
	Nutrition and Hydration: Assist with feeding, serving meals, and ensuring patients have access to water and other fluids.
	Hygiene and Environment: Maintain a clean and safe environment, including patient rooms and common areas.
	Communication: Communicate effectively with patients, families, and healthcare team members.
	Documentation: Accurately document patient information and care provided.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND, OND, SSCE / GCE / NECO qualification with 2 - 5 years of work experience.
	Experience: Previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred.
	Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Physical Ability: Ability to lift, move, and transfer patients safely.


Working Conditions:


	Work Environment: Hospital or healthcare facility.
	Shift Work: May include day, evening, night, or rotating shifts.


Salary
N40,000 - N55,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letters and CV to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Pharmacy Technician

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Pharmacy Technician assists the pharmacist with dispensing medications, maintaining patient records, and performing administrative tasks.
	They play a vital role in ensuring the smooth operation of the pharmacy.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist with dispensing medications, including counting, labeling, and packaging.
	Maintain patient records and profiles.
	Process prescriptions, including data entry and verification.
	Manage inventory, including ordering and stocking medications.
	Provide excellent customer service and answer patient questions.
	Assist with administrative tasks, such as filing.


Requirements


	Diploma in Pharmacy Technician or equivalent with 1 - 5 years of work experience.
	Completion of a pharmacy technician training program.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.


Salary
N50,000 - N70,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 15th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "Respected Solutions is a leading pawn shop in Nigeria, providing quick and reliable loans against cars, gold, luxury watches, gadgets, and other valuables. Whether you require a loan against gold, luxury watch, jewelry, or even a against car, we provide competitive interest rates and easy repayment options. Our government approved and licensed services guarantee a secure and trustworthy borrowing experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Account Officer to join our finance department. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or early-career professional to gain hands-on experience in a comprehensive accounting role.
	You will be instrumental in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our financial records, contributing directly to the company&#39;s financial health and strategic decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
As a Account Officer, you will work closely with the Senior Accountant and be responsible for a range of critical duties, including:


	Bookkeeping &amp; General Ledger: Managing the daily transactions, including accounts payable and accounts receivable, and ensuring the general ledger is maintained accurately.
	Bank Reconciliation: Performing monthly reconciliation of bank statements to the general ledger.
	Invoice &amp; Expense Processing: Handling all company invoicing, tracking expense reports, and processing payments to vendors and suppliers.
	Reporting: Preparing various financial reports for management, including budget-to-actual variance analysis.


Qualifications


	Education: A Bachelor&#39;s degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Experience: 2-3 years of relevant experience.
	Soft Skills: High level of attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and excellent written and verbal communication.
	Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUPs).
	Promixity to location is key


Why Join Us?


	Competitive Salary: Receive a salary between N180,000 - N200,000 monthly.&nbsp;(Depending on experience and qualifications)
	Professional Growth: Opportunity for continuous learning and career advancement within the finance team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;idrisd_hro@ontherun.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Account Officer Job at Respected Solutions




        
    

        
        Respected Solutions is a leading pawn shop in Nigeria, providing quick and reliable loans against cars, gold, luxury watches, gadgets, and other valuables. Whether you require a loan against gold, luxury watch, jewelry, or even a against car, we provide competitive interest rates and easy repayment options. Our government approved and licensed services guarantee a secure and trustworthy borrowing experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location: Ikota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Account Officer to join our finance department. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or early-career professional to gain hands-on experience in a comprehensive accounting role.
	You will be instrumental in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our financial records, contributing directly to the company's financial health and strategic decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
As a Account Officer, you will work closely with the Senior Accountant and be responsible for a range of critical duties, including:


	Bookkeeping & General Ledger: Managing the daily transactions, including accounts payable and accounts receivable, and ensuring the general ledger is maintained accurately.
	Bank Reconciliation: Performing monthly reconciliation of bank statements to the general ledger.
	Invoice & Expense Processing: Handling all company invoicing, tracking expense reports, and processing payments to vendors and suppliers.
	Reporting: Preparing various financial reports for management, including budget-to-actual variance analysis.


Qualifications


	Education: A Bachelor's degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Experience: 2-3 years of relevant experience.
	Soft Skills: High level of attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and excellent written and verbal communication.
	Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUPs).
	Promixity to location is key


Why Join Us?


	Competitive Salary: Receive a salary between N180,000 - N200,000 monthly. (Depending on experience and qualifications)
	Professional Growth: Opportunity for continuous learning and career advancement within the finance team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: idrisd_hro@ontherun.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Key Account Executive",
  "description": "Wemy Industries is one of the foremost indigenous and oldest established manufacturers in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in producing baby diapers, feminine sanitary napkins/pads, panty liners, adult diapers, maternity pads, under pads and baby wipes under the umbrella brand names of &lsquo;Dr. Browns&rsquo; and &lsquo;Nightingale&rsquo;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As a Key Account Executive, you will be the primary point of contact for our most valued clients. Your mission is to nurture long-term partnerships, understand client needs, and ensure seamless delivery of products.
	You&rsquo;ll collaborate closely with internal teams to exceed customer expectations and unlock new business opportunities.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow relationships with key accounts in the manufacturing sector
	Understand client operations, challenges, and goals to offer tailored solutions
	Coordinate with production, logistics, and technical teams to ensure timely delivery
	Monitor account performance, analyse trends, and report on KPIs
	Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities
	Resolve issues promptly and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction
	Stay informed on industry trends and competitor activities


Qualifications


	Candidates should Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in business administration, Marketing or related field
	1-3 years of experience in sales account management, preferably in manufacturing or industrial sales (Modern trade)&nbsp;
	Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
	Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and meet sales targets
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities
	Proficiency in CRM tools and Microsoft Office Suite
	Willingness to travel as needed.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;ololade@wemydrbrowns.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Key Account Executive Job at Wemy Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Wemy Industries is one of the foremost indigenous and oldest established manufacturers in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in producing baby diapers, feminine sanitary napkins/pads, panty liners, adult diapers, maternity pads, under pads and baby wipes under the umbrella brand names of ‘Dr. Browns’ and ‘Nightingale’

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Executive

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Key Account Executive, you will be the primary point of contact for our most valued clients. Your mission is to nurture long-term partnerships, understand client needs, and ensure seamless delivery of products.
	You’ll collaborate closely with internal teams to exceed customer expectations and unlock new business opportunities.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow relationships with key accounts in the manufacturing sector
	Understand client operations, challenges, and goals to offer tailored solutions
	Coordinate with production, logistics, and technical teams to ensure timely delivery
	Monitor account performance, analyse trends, and report on KPIs
	Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities
	Resolve issues promptly and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction
	Stay informed on industry trends and competitor activities


Qualifications


	Candidates should Bachelor’s Degree in business administration, Marketing or related field
	1-3 years of experience in sales account management, preferably in manufacturing or industrial sales (Modern trade) 
	Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
	Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and meet sales targets
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities
	Proficiency in CRM tools and Microsoft Office Suite
	Willingness to travel as needed.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ololade@wemydrbrowns.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
